result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roger Yang

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Proposed Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency)

Case called at 10:30 AM.
Defendant Roger Yang in court with Attorney Andrew T Knaak.  Deputy District Attorney Angela Lynn Beranek in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Parties stipulate to the competency report that the Defendant is not competent but likely to regain competency.
Court accepts the report and orders the Defendant committed to DHS.
Court finds the Defendant to be eligible for the Competency Outpatient Restoration Program.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: It is ordered that Attorney Richard Yonko is withdrawn as counsel.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Dated 09/19/2022, Letter from Attorney Richard Yonko to Court requesting to withdraw as counsel.
Competency hearing on October 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:31 PM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Angela Lynn Beranek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Richard Louis Yonko in court for Roger Yang. Defendant Roger Yang not in court. Guardian for Mr. Yang appears via Zoom. 

2:35 PM- Defendant appears in court.

Attorney Yonko to arrange appointment for the Defendant.

Bond continues.
Dated 08/25/2022, Letter from Ryan Stepp, Psy.D., to Court regarding inability to contact defendant for Competency Evaluation.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services
Proposed Order for Competency Examination by DHS
Competency hearing on September 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Conditions:
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
No use or possession of weapons.

(11:20 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Roger Yang appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Clayton Cavanaugh Law Intern, supervised by Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for Roger Yang.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing.
State raises competency. Defense also raises competency.
Court review the complaint and finds probable cause. Court orders competency examination be completed.
Defendant updates phone number with the Court.
Competency Hearing to be scheduled in Branch 4.

Conditions:
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
No use or possession of weapons.
